agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance abuse issues and their families. Intensive outpatient services are available.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call intake line to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open; minimum age determined by individual assessment

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides information, training, and placement for people interested in becoming foster parents.
site_name: DEBRA CORN FOSTER CARE - WINSLOW OFFICE
service_description: Provides information, training, and placement for people interested in becoming foster parents.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Legal resident of Indiana -- Age 21 or older -- Able to pass appropriate criminal and medical background checks -- With resources to care for one or more children in need of specialized and therapeutic foster care

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call or send an email to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Pike County.
service_description: Offers weather alert radios to persons in need, while supplies last. Weather alert radios provide information for emergencies including hazardous weather, local area warnings, and current weather conditions from the National Weather Service.
site_details: Call for availability or to make a request.
site_eligibility: Living in Pike County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for details.

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the  city of Petersburg in Pike County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Petersburg in Pike County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or walk in during office hours for information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Petersburg in Pike County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Pike County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Pike County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Pike County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Pike County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Winslow in Pike County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Winslow in Pike County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Pike County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Winslow Indiana in Pike County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8:30am
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8:30am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services.--  Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, and Wed 9am-5pm; Thurs 9am-7pm; Fri 9am-3pm; Sat 9am-1pm
Mon, Tues, and Wed 9am-5pm; Thurs 9am-7pm; Fri 9am-3pm; Sat 9am-1pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Pike County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: PIKE COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY - WINSLOW BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Pike County

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Pike County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment or walk in during office hours. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm --Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm --Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Pike County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides transportation to medical appointments for area veterans to the veterans' hospital or clinic in Evansville, Indianapolis, New Albany, or Vincennes, Indiana
site_details: Must schedule at least 3 days in advance; Call for more information.
site_schedule: Office: Tues, Wed, Thurs 8am-3:30pm -- Transportation: By appointment
site_eligibility: Veterans living in Pike County -- With an appointment at the veterans' hospital or clinic in Evansville, Indianapolis, New Albany, or Vincennes, Indiana

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Pike County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Pike County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on property description and ownership.
site_details: Call or walk in for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Pike County

agency_desc: "TRI-CAP empowers people in our communities to accept responsibility for achieving personal and economic well-being by providing health, housing, and educational services."
service_description: Offers individual development savings accounts for low-income adults. Participants receive matching funds for money they save toward buying or rehabilitating a home, paying for post-secondary education, or starting or expanding a small business. Participants may also use funds for a vehicle purchase to obtain or maintain employment or education. Participants attend financial literacy workshops and assistance developing short- and long-term savings goals.
site_details: Call for enrollment information.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois, Pike, or Warrick County -- At or below 200% Federal Poverty Income Guidelines
